overview_of_class: Principles and practice of using aerial photographs to obtain information about natural features of the earth's surface, with emphasis on earth materials. Landforms, geological processes, rocks, and soils. Stereoscopic photographs, elements of photogrammetry. Project required in addition to lab and home work.
name: Airphoto Interpretation
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 358-0-1 Airphoto Interpretation
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Graduate Students.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Principles and practice of using aerial photographs to obtain information about natural features of the earth's surface, with emphasis on earth materials. Landforms, geological processes, rocks, and soils. Stereoscopic photographs, elements of photogrammetry. Project required in addition to lab and home work.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Junior or Senior standing; permission number

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Way, D.S., Terrain Analysis: Site Selection Using Ariel Photographs, McGraw Hill, 1978. (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $60).
Photographs from Way duplicated with high resolution to permit proper 3D display (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $30)
Course Handouts (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $10)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Hamblin, W. & Howard, J. Exercises in Physical Geology, Ninth Edition

subject: CIV_ENV
